column5: Well tomorrow I will be leaving my home and family in Oshawa and will be moving out to Lindsay to be going to Fleming College. Year 1 of the Fish & Wildlife Tech program begins on Tuesday but being on my own starts  tomorrow  . Living off campus and away from home for the first time will be a experience in it's self.  I have a few people that will be showing me the area and will be helping me get started out along with my passion of fishing. Yes, more to come this fall from MTBF   Wish me luck up there, as my plan goes education and studies come first, then fishing and well the other stuff that happens at college lol.  So long Oshawa, hopefully setting up the internet doesn't take long...I need my OFC!  Wish me luck, this should be fun! MTBF  O also, what conservation areas are closest or inside of Lindsay, looking to do some volunteering with the local Conservation Authority like I have done here.
Good luck and I'm pretty sure that you'll enjoy it, especially in a field that you already love so much.  I hope that you'll still be able to get out and I look forward to your reports!
Good luck MTBF,  I think you'll like the school. There will be tons of students that enjoy fishing as much as you...You might not even need us for a while. Who said that?  Lots of fishing spots too.
Have a great time! And good luck.
good luck! I remember when i moved to lindsay and went to fleming. It was a great place and made some good friends! That was 10 years ago.

there is a couple conservation areas mike, ken reid is closest to lindsay there is also the pigeon river authority fleetwood creek and a newer one on mt horeb rd that escapes me at the moment, hit me up sometime i can give you a tour of sturgeon lake bass sometime
You're a good kid Mike, and I'm sure you will do well!  Make the most of your opportunity!!!
cya there buddy i wont be up there until Jan tho. but I'll keep my eye out
Well I'm all moved in! Have yet to meet my roommates but hey life is good so far. Next step is to explore Lindsay on the bike for abit, watch a movie and get some rest, lots to do tomorrow.
